results.name: Decimal expansion of sqrt(Pi)/2.
reference: C. C. Clawson, The Beauty and Magic of Numbers. New York: Plenum Press (1996): 210.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
I. S. Gradsteyn, I. M. Ryzhik, Table of integrals, series and products, (1980), page 420 (formulas 3.757.1, 3.757.2).
Michael Penn, An interesting approach to the Gaussian integral, YouTube video, 2021.
Index to sequences related to the Gamma function
formula: Equals Integral_{x=0..infinity} exp(-x^2) dx = Integral_{x=0..infinity} exp(-(x - 1/x)^2) dx = Integral_{x=0..1} sqrt(log(1/x)) dx. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 28 2013
Equals Integral_{x >= 0} sin(2x)/sqrt(x) dx [Gradshteyn and Ryzhik].
Equals Integral_{x >= 0} cos(2x)/sqrt(x) dx [Gradshteyn and Ryzhik]. (End)
Equals Integral_{x=0..oo} sin(x^2)^2/x^2 dx. - _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 21 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
